MPS Approves 2030 Plan, Targets EUR700 Million in Synergies with Mediobanca
data.description:
(Alliance News) - Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena Spa announced on Friday the approval of its 20262030 Industrial Plan, titled "From deep roots to new frontiers, a leading competitive force in banking." The plan follows the successful public exchange and tender offer for Mediobanca, which saw an 86.3% acceptance rate, and foresees the merger by incorporation of Mediobanca into MPS, with full-run synergies amounting to EUR700 million.

The new group aims to become the third-largest banking player in Italy, with over 7 million customers and a significant contribution from high-fee activities, including Asset Gathering & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, and Private Banking, representing approximately 44% of total pro-forma revenues.

On the financial front, the plan projects a net interest and fee margin of EUR9.5 billion in 2030, compared to EUR7.6 billion in 2025, an adjusted net profit of EUR3.7 billion versus EUR2.4 billion, and a cost/income ratio reduced to 38% from 46%.

The CET1 ratio is expected to remain around 16% throughout the plan's horizon, with a 100% payout and cumulative distributions estimated at about EUR16 billion.

Breaking down the divisions, Retail & Commercial Banking is expected to increase its net interest and fee margin to about EUR2.6 billion in 2030 from around EUR2.1 billion in 2025, with loans rising to approximately EUR82 billion from EUR66 billion.

Consumer Finance, through Compass, targets revenues of around EUR1.7 billion in 2030 from about EUR1.3 billion, and loans of about EUR21 billion from EUR17 billion, with the cost/income ratio declining to 27% from 31%.

Asset Gathering & Wealth Management aims for revenues of about EUR2.0 billion from EUR1.5 billion, and total assets increasing to around EUR185 billion from EUR142 billion.

In Private Banking, revenues are expected to reach EUR900 million from EUR600 million.

Corporate & Investment Banking is projected to achieve a net interest and fee margin of about EUR1.3 billion, while Principal Investing, also supported by a roughly 13% stake in Assicurazioni Generali, expects revenues to grow to about EUR800 million from EUR600 million.

By Antonio Di Giorgio, Alliance News reporter

Comments and questions to redazione@alliancenews.com

Copyright 2026 Alliance News IS Italian Service Ltd. All rights reserved.

Swiss Re posts 47% rise in 2025 net profit, but life and health weighs
data.description:
FRANKFURT, Feb 27 (Reuters) - Reinsurance company Swiss Re said on Friday its 2025 net profit rose 47%, slightly better than expected, and helped by strength in its property and casualty business.

The rise came despite a 17% decline in profit at its health and life division, that led it to miss a target for the business.

Group net profit of $4.762 billion in the period compares with a profit of $3.238 billion a year earlier. Analysts had expected a profit of $4.724 billion, according to a consensus forecast.

Swiss Re warned last year that it would miss the full-year profit target in its life and health division after higher-than-expected claims.

The reinsurer, among the world's largest, had said smaller health portfolios in Australia and elsewhere were underperforming its expectations.

In October, Swiss Re said it would pause new life and health business in Australia following a sharp rise in claims there after local insurers paid out more in mental health claims and younger people were put on permanent disability.

Profit in the division was $1.274 billion for 2025, down from $1.532 billion in 2024 and short of a target of about $1.6 billion.

(Reporting by Tom Sims and Oliver Hirt, Editing by Friederike Heine and Clarence Fernandez)

data.title: BASF Swings to Net Profit on Accelerated Cost Savings
data.description:
By Nina Kienle


Germany's BASF returned to net profit in the fourth quarter, supported by cost savings programs and its streamlining of the organization.

The German chemical giant on Friday said it swung to a net profit in the fourth quarter of 560 million euros ($660.8 million) from a loss of 786 million euros in the prior-year period. The figure beat analysts' forecast of 285 million euros, according to consensus estimates provided by the company.

Sales for the period declined 5.6% to 14.03 billion euros, compared with analysts' estimated 14.04 billion euros.

The company is undergoing a comprehensive restructuring that involves streamlining its portfolio, selling noncore assets, spinning off its agricultural business and cutting jobs.

BASF also confirmed preliminary figures for 2025. Sales amounted to 59.66 billion euros, down 2.9%. Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization and special items fell 9.5% to 6.55 billion euros.

The Ludwigshafen-based company said it accelerated the implementation of its existing cost savings programs. By end-2025 it achieved a total annual cost reduction run rate of around 1.7 billion euros, an increase of 100 million euros compared to its original target.

BASF said it would keep a dividend of 2.25 euros per share.

For 2026, BASF is targeting Ebitda before special items of 6.2 billion euros to 7.0 billion euros, and free cash flow of between 1.5 billion and 2.3 billion euros.


Write to Nina Kienle at nina.kienle@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

02-27-26 0146ET

China's Politburo Reiterates Pro-Growth Stance
data.description:
China's top leaders reiterated their pro-growth policy stance as they convened a meeting to prepare for March's agenda-setting annual legislative session.

The ruling Communist Party's Politburo, China's highest decision-making body, met Friday to discuss the country's 15th Five-year Plan and a government work report that senior lawmakers are set to review early next month.

Officials at the gathering reiterated their commitment to a more proactive fiscal policy and a moderately loose monetary policy in 2026. They also pledged to continue expanding domestic demand and optimizing supply.

Friday's meeting came before next week's annual National People's Congress session. Roughly 3,000 representatives, including senior officials, will discuss and approve major economic targets for the world's second-largest economy for 2026 and the next five years.

China is widely expected to set an annual growth target of 4.5%-5.0%, a pragmatic downgrade from its previous "around 5%" goal, given that domestic demand remains weak.

Analysts say the tweak to the target, if approved, would make aggressive stimulus measures this year much less likely.

"Fiscal policy will likely continue to play the leading role, though with a slightly narrower official deficit than in 2025 as trade uncertainty eases and policy makers shift from 'extraordinary' to 'necessary' counter--cyclical support," said economists at Standard Chartered in their preview of March's legislature session.

They expect monetary policy to remain measured, focusing on providing ample liquidity rather than large rate cuts.

Write to Singapore editors at singaporeeditors@dowjones.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

02-27-26 0143ET

data.title: Gold broadly steady as fall in Treasury yields balances tempered safe-haven bids
data.description:
Feb 27 (Reuters) - Gold was broadly steady on Friday as a drop in U.S. Treasury yields eased the opportunity cost of holding bullion, while muted safe-haven demand kept prices in check as investors assess U.S-Iran negotiations.

Spot gold edged up 0.1% at $5,192.19 per ounce by 0543 GMT. The benchmark 10-year yield fell to a three-month low on the day.

"Ten-year U.S. Treasury yields after subtracting inflation, so the real yield, have plummeted and that actually is currently a supporting factor, allowing gold to hold steady regardless of the risk premiums ticking down yesterday after U.S.-Iran talks," said Kelvin Wong, a senior market analyst at OANDA.

Gold was set for its seventh straight month of gains, rising more than 6% in February, a month in which renewed U.S. tariff uncertainty and U.S.-Iran tensions boosted its safe-haven appeal.

The U.S. and Iran made progress in Geneva on Thursday over Tehran's nuclear programme, mediator Oman said, but hours of negotiation ended without a breakthrough to avert potential U.S. strikes amid a massive military buildup.

U.S. gold futures for April delivery were up 0.3% at $5,209.20.

The dollar was set to gain 0.6% for the month, as indications of a more hawkish Federal Reserve made dollar-priced gold more expensive for holders of other currencies. [USD/][US/]

Fed Chair nominee Kevin Warsh's path to out-of-the-gate interest rate cuts, in alignment with President Donald Trump's expectations, could be narrowing amid emerging bullishness about the U.S. economy.

The number of Americans filing new applications for jobless benefits increased slightly last week, but data showed that the unemployment rate appeared to hold steady in February in a stable labour market.

Markets currently expect at least three 25-basis-point Fed rate cuts this year, according to CME's FedWatch Tool. [FEDWATCH]

Spot silver rose 1.6% to $89.73 per ounce, and was headed for a 6.1% gain on the month.

Spot platinum climbed 5.2% to $2,260.09 per ounce, a four-week high, while palladium gained 2.3% to $1,825.29.

(Reporting by Ishaan Arora in Bengaluru; Editing by Sumana Nandy, Rashmi Aich and Ronojoy Mazumdar)

By Ishaan Arora

data.title: EQT Sells Final Shares in Azelis
data.description:
Private equity firm EQT has divested its remaining holding of approximately 24 million shares, representing about 10 percent of the capital, in Belgian specialty chemicals company Azelis.

The sale was completed on February 26.

The transaction generated a total of around 190 million euros, of which EQT VIII received approximately 173 million euros. This marks the end of more than eight years of ownership in the chemical distributor.

Azelis was listed on the stock exchange in 2021.

data.title: Ubs Group Ag Announces Changes to Its Board and Committee
data.description: UBS Group AG announced that William C. Dudley and Jeanette Wong have also decided to step down after seven years on the Board. During this time, Mr. Dudley served on the Corporate Culture and Responsibility Committee, the Risk Committee and the Governance and Nominating Committee. Ms. Wong was a member of the Audit Committee, the Corporate Culture and Responsibility Committee and the Compensation Committee.

EDF Successfully Launches €2.75 Billion Green Bond Issuance
data.description:
EDF has successfully raised €2.75 billion through a four-tranche senior green bond issuance.

This issuance includes €500 million in bonds with a 2-year maturity and a floating coupon of Euribor 3M + 0.33%, €750 million in bonds with a 5-year maturity and a fixed coupon of 3.0%, €1 billion in bonds with a 12-year maturity and a fixed coupon of 4.0%, and €500 million in bonds with a 20-year maturity and a fixed coupon of 4.5%.

An amount equal to the net proceeds from the bond issuance will be allocated to the financing and/or refinancing of investments corresponding to the eligible project categories defined in EDF's Green Financing Framework.

The 2-year and 5-year tranches are dedicated to extending the lifespan of existing nuclear reactors in France, while the 12-year and 20-year tranches will support the construction of the pair of EPR nuclear reactors at Hinkley Point C in the United Kingdom.

With demand reaching €11 billion, the operation attracted significant investor interest and was oversubscribed by more than four times. This will enable EDF to finance its strategy and contribute to achieving carbon neutrality by 2050.

Settlement and delivery of the bonds is expected to take place on March 4, 2026, at which time the bonds are scheduled to be admitted to trading on the regulated market of Euronext Paris.

UCB SA Reports Earnings Results for the Full Year Ended December 31, 2025
data.description:
UCB SA reported earnings results for the full year ended December 31, 2025. For the full year, the company reported sales was EUR 7,388 million compared to EUR 5,613 million a year ago. Revenue was EUR 7,741 million compared to EUR 6,152 million a year ago.

Net income was EUR 1,558 million compared to EUR 1,065 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was EUR 8.2 compared to EUR 5.61 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was EUR 8.03 compared to EUR 5.48 a year ago.

Basic earnings per share was EUR 8.2 compared to EUR 5.61 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was EUR 8.03 compared to EUR 5.48 a year ago.

data.title: Hyundai Motor Group to Invest USD 6.3 Billion in AI Data Centre, Robot Factory in South Korea
data.description:
Hyundai Motor Group and South Korea on February 27, 2026 signed a deal to invest about KRW 9 trillion (USD 6.26 billion) to build an AI data centre, a robot manufacturing factory and other developments in the country's western coastal region. Hyundai Motor Group to invest about KRW 5.8 trillion to build an AI data centre, which will deploy 50,000 graphics processing units. Group will spend KRW 400 billion on a factory to produce robots including wearable ones.

Group will invest KRW 1 trillion in hydrogen production facilites, another KRW 1.3 trillion in solar generation.

Sunway Healthcare Eyes $4.3 Billion Market Cap in Malaysia's Biggest IPO Since 2017
data.description:
By Ying Xian Wong


KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia--The healthcare arm of Malaysian conglomerate Sunway is eyeing a market capitalization of over $4 billion as its initial public offering gets underway.

Sunway Healthcare is looking to raise about $736.3 million in what would be Malaysia's biggest IPO in nearly a decade.

The company said in a filing Friday that it is pricing 1.97 billion shares at 1.45 ringgit each, implying a market capitalization of about 16.7 billion ringgit, or $4.30 billion.

That would make it one of the biggest listed healthcare providers in Malaysia.

It plans to issue 575 million new shares and will use the proceeds raised to expand its hospitals, redeem bonds and cover listing expenses.

The Wall Street Journal had previously reported on the healthcare company's plan to go public.

Sunway Healthcare's listing comes amid improving sentiment in Asia markets.

Stock exchanges across the region, including in Japan and South Korea, have been on a run of record highs, and emerging markets are increasingly in favor among investors seeking diversification and cheaper valuations.

Malaysia's benchmark Kuala Lumpur Composite Index is trading at levels not seen since 2019, and its IPO market is gathering steam.

That is helping make businesses more confident about dipping their toes into public markets even as geopolitical uncertainty and volatility persist.

Last year, Malaysia hosted 60 listings--the most in two decades. Momentum has continued this year, with companies in various sectors lining up to go public.

Sunway Healthcare's offering looks set to draw healthy demand. It has secured 20 cornerstone investors, including AHAM Asset Management, AIA, Eastspring Investments and JPMorgan Asset Management (Singapore), which have agreed to subscribe to 97.5% of the allocated shares.

For the company, the IPO is a way to fuel its bid to establish a presence in Southeast Asia, executive chairman Jeffrey Cheah said at a press conference on Friday.

Sunway Healthcare has been expanding its footprint across Malaysia and expects to grow its bed capacity to 3,400 by 2032. It currently has 1,805 licensed beds, said the company's president, Lau Beng Long.

Shares of Sunway Healthcare are set to begin trading on Malaysia's main bourse on March 18.

Maybank Investment Bank and AmInvestment Bank are advising on the offering.


Write to Ying Xian Wong at yingxian.wong@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

02-27-26 0118ET
